instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER: What is SMC_ADAPTER? SMC_ADAPTER_EN is an abbreviation of SMC_ADAPTER_EN, which enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Hello
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage around <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U7541</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7730</CHIP>. <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> was shorted to 0 Ohms resistance to ground. Found short on <CHIP>U7541</CHIP>. Removed and replaced <CHIP>U7541</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7730</CHIP> along with surrounding components. Resistance to ground on Vcore is now 1.1 Ohms. Also, I do not have a green/amber light on charger even though it seems I have PP3V42 on multiple TP's. Here are some measurements.

PPBUS - 12.57V
PP3v42 - 3.414V
PPDCIN - 14.77V
PPVRTC - 3.343V
<SIGNAL>SYS_ONE</SIGNAL> - 3.32 - 3.412V (Fluctuates)
<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> - 16.07V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER</SIGNAL> _EN - 3.373V
ACOK - 2.59V - 3.1V (Fluctuates)

Wondering why no green light.

Genuine charger, known working magsafe. 

Thanks, Have a good day.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage
threads.message: CPU is already dead probably, time waster board.
